title: Python Scripts
content:
I am trying to convert my old armenian fonts to unicode. I have a lot of fonts and I was thinking if there is a pyhton script that can help me. What I need is a script similar to the “Rename glyphs by scheme [TTG]” script, only it has to renumber the glyphs from one unicode # to another.

Is there any such script?
author: levonk

comments.content: The easiest way to do this is simply to build a new .nam file that associates glyph names to Unicode values. Then all you need to do is apply the “Generate Unicode’ function in FontLab.

Thanks John.

It is taking some time to get it to work without any mistakes, but it will work eventually.
